intro: Tetrapilus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed tetrapilus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive serrated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Tetrapilus dentatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
